intro: Xanthisma berlandieri, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and woolly, silver-gray foliage. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Xanthisma berlandieri is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and drought, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
